snippet: Higher blood levels of omega-3 fatty acids, vitamin B, vitamin C, vitamin D and vitamin E are associated with better mental functioning in the elderly, a study shows.
abstract: Study published in journal Neurology finds that higher blood levels of omega-3 fatty acids, and of nutrients vitamin B, vitamin C, vitamin D and vitamin E are associated with better mental functioning in the elderly; Gene L Bowman of Oregon Health and Science University is study's lead author.
lead_paragraph: Higher blood levels of omega-3 fatty acids, vitamin B, vitamin C, vitamin D and vitamin E are associated with better mental functioning in the elderly, a study shows.

headline.seo: Vitamins B, C, D and E and Omega-3 Strengthen Older Brains
headline.main: Nutrition: 4 Vitamins That Strengthen Older Brains
headline.print_headline: Nutrition: 4 Vitamins That Strengthen Older Brains
